body.name: EZDIY-FAB Vertical PCIe 4.0 GPU Mount Bracket Graphic Card Holder with 5V 3 Pin ARGB LED Module, Video Card VGA Support Kit with PCIe 4.0 X16 Gen4 17cm/6.69in Riser Cable 90 Degree Right Angle- White
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 15 hrs 20 mins
features: New designed bracket to vertically show off GPU. Supports most 1, 2, and 3 slot graphic cards. Designed for most full/mid ATX tower with at least 7 available PCI slots.

High quality material increases structural toughness and supports the large graphics card weight on the market. Beautiful metal surface treatment, installed in the chassis to form a beautiful landscape.

Vertical GPU Bracket with ARGB LED lighting effects, Synchronizable ARGB lighting via motherboard (AURA, Mystic, Fusion):Support M/B 3 Pin ARGB Header (5V, D, G), Please note : Not Support 4pin RGB header (+12V, G,R,B), 12 volts can destroy LED.
Thanks to Stretchable Structure design, you would be able to connect HDMI, DP cable to your GPU without hassle, compatible to PC chassis with PCI grilles.
Please test the riser cable onto the GPU first before installing the GPU to vertical bracket mount./ Please refer to length spec image and confirm that there is enough space of your chassis.
Supports PCIE 4.0/3.0/2.0/1.0,Compatible with RTX3090, RTX3080, RTX3070, RTX3060TI, RX6900XT, RX6800.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Vertical Your GPU, Best Visual Angle, Stunning ARGB Lighting effects. Nowadays, the graphics cards on the market are getting bigger and bigger and the appearance is very eye-catching, the new released vertical graphics card mount allows vertical installation of a GPU on any chassis to better show off the visual design of the GPU and its cooler. Equipped with 11pcs of Addressable RGB LED lights, ARGB provides full lighting for your build, it can be synced with other 5V ARGB devices by M/B.

Bigger Graphics Card Support Verified Supports most 1, 2, and 3 slot graphic cards.Designed for most full/mid ATX tower with at least 7 available PCI slots.Compatible with most brand's Graphic cardPlease refer to length spec image and confirm that there is enough space of your chassis.

Equipped With PCIE4.0 Riser Cable- Cable length 6.69in/17cm Compatible with RTX3090, RTX3080, RTX3070, RTX3060TI, RX6900XT, RX6800.Assemble the graphics card and GPU Mount first, then adjust and lock the riser cable screw. NOTE: Please test the riser cable onto the GPU first before installing the GPU to vertical bracket mount.
INSTALLATION GUIDE Assemble Metal Part I Assemble Metal Part II Put On Riser Cable. In this step, do not mount the screw of the riser cable. Connect GPU To The Riser Cable.
Mount the GPU to bracket Mount the screw of riser cable and connect to motherboard PCIEx16_1 slot. Mount the bracket to the case. Optional assembly of L-shaped support bracket
L-Shaped Bracket for Supporting heavy card Optional install, assembling with heavy card prevent sagging.Small Rubber pad could be attached to the L-shaped bracket.Maximum support up to 1.89in/48mm.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing product at a very competitive price
reviews.reviewText: This GPU bracket is by far the cheapest one available that comes with a PCIe 4.0 riser cable, and I decided to take the plunge even though it's a new product.Installation was super simple and the sliding feature came in handy because I was able to run my DisplayPort cable through without having to saw off my PCI slots. The bracket seems very sturdy and my GPU is definitely staying in place without any sag.The riser cable is a bit long, so it's a little bit of a tight fit as it's touching part of the motherboard, but thus far there have not been any issues. My PC booted up normally after installation, and benchmarks show that performance is virtually identical to plugging the GPU straight into the motherboard. The GPU sits far enough away from the glass that there have not been any increases in temperature during load either.Overall, I'm super satisfied with this product and will definitely be buying more products from this seller in the future!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars PCIe cable did not work.
reviews.reviewText: It looks decent, I feel like it's far too large to be practical, it could be much more compact and serve the same purpose. It's a little difficult to install, with better engineering it could be much easier and more simple to install. Included instructions aren't clear either.Mine didn't work, most likely something wrong with the cable. Whenever I used this mount, games would freeze up and glitch out after only a minute or two. As soon as I removed the bracket and installed directly into the motherboard, it worked fine.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great except for riser cable and color
reviews.reviewText: The vertical mount is overall great, sturdy and easy to assemble. However the color is not a true black. Seams like a blueish tinted black. Can’t really notice it unless you have tons of rgb within the case. The bracket also has some sharp edges. I masked the areas where my riser cable would rub on with electrical tape to prevent a shortage. The riser cable is also not great quality. I have trust issues with riser cables either frying your components or catching on fire. I used my trusted Lian li 4.0 cable. It didn’t match the holes so I used a m3 screw with a nut and plastic washers to hold it in place. Probably will end up drilling a new hole and tapping on the bracket itself. Note that not all riser cables will fit this specific bracket. The sliding option is cool. Better cooling temps now that the gpu is away from the glass. Overall over priced but worth it if you need a good vertical mount.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fits 3.5 Slot RTX 4090
reviews.reviewText: The bracket is pretty sturdy and I was able to fit my PNY 4090 in the Lian Li O11 Dynamic (non-evo, non-XL) using this. Previously I had to keep the side panel open due to the power adapter but now everything is neatly packed. The bracket also left enough room for the bottom intake fans and the bracket (without the stand) just rests on top of the fan to prevent sag. The only downside is the temp has gone from 66C to 72C (50% fan on stock fan curve). Please keep in mind that the 66C was with the side panel open so I don't know how much of that is because of the side panel or vertical mounting. 72 is still pretty comfortable for me so a non-issue and the GPU looks great. Overall a great buy in my case as I tried the Phantek one before this and it did not fit and was probably 5 times more flimsy that this.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Bracket is fine but the cable is not PCIE gen 4.
reviews.reviewText: I got this vertical mount kit not because it was cheaper but because it was much faster to ship than the Thermal take one. I was aware of some reviews stating that the riser cable wasn't sufficient for Gen 4, but I installed it anyway.After installation I used GPU-Z to check and it did indeed say the card was running at PCIE gen 4. I was happy with that and continued to use my PC.After heavier usage I did start to get some blue screen crashes and upon checking the windows 11 event log I discovered hundreds of errors pointing to a PCI-E device (WHEA event 17). In the BIOS for the PC I forced the GPU to run at Gen 3 and the errors disappeared. I decided to buy a higher quality riser cable from Linkup for $60, and after installing it I was able to set my GPU back to gen 4 without any errors appearing.In conclusion: the bracket is fine, it seems to go uphill a bit from the case connection which is kind of annoying but it's fine. The riser cable, while it even says PCIe 4.0 on the connector itself l, doesn't seem to be able to actually handle gen 4 speeds, causing crashes and errors. In total, I had to spend $120 for the kit and a replacement riser cable. In hindsight, I should have just waited for the Thermaltake kit.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Looked good but functionally, too flimsy for the weight of a 4090. It would be fine for smaller, lighter GPU's.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Does the job well.
reviews.reviewText: Works good for my 4070TI. I've got the H9 case. I'm sure theres better mounts out there but I'm not taking my pc to run around town so it's sturdy enough. And easy to put togather.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Do not buy
reviews.reviewText: I recently finished building my new PC with this product to mount my gigabyte aero 4070 vertically. Upon first power up of my PC, my GPU would not power on. Thankfully my Intel CPU has integrated graphics and the system would post on the video out of the board. The GPU fans would not spin and the the RGB on the GPU would not light up. I suspected the EZDIY vertical GPU mount was the culprit. So I ordered the NZXT vertical GPU mount which was not available for months until recently. After I installed the NZXT vertical GPU mount into my NZXT H5 elite and powered up the system the GPU finally came to life. And yes I did reseat several times and check all the connections before the new mount. Unfortunately I ordered this piece of crap several months ago way past the return window. So I removed the 4 screws holding the rgb strip and put under the NZXT mount and threw this piece of garbage in the trash. Don't waste your $60.00 like I did.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: No performance lost on sapphire nitro+ rx 7900 xtx , in my case, actually it's batter temperatures then horizontal mount, thanks and highly recommend 👍

reviews.reviewTitle: Macht was es soll und das auch noch gut !
reviews.reviewText: Dieses Gestell ist sehr stabil und hällt die Grafikkarte gut auf Position. Es wackelt nichts und passt hervorragend. Der "riser" überträgt die Daten für PCIe 4x x16 ohne (für mich spür- oder messbaren) Geschwindigkeitsverlust.Alles in allem ne gute Sache ! Der Preis passt auch. Manche Riser-kabel sind alleine schon 50 - 60 €.Von mir durchaus eine Kaufempfehlung.Info: habe das Set benutzt um in einem Gehäuse, in dem das Mainboard flach auf der Bodenplatte montiert ist (Antech skeleton), die Grafikkarte (Radeon RX7800XT) waagerecht auf dem Board zu montieren da die Karte sonst nicht rein passt. (Siehe Bild)

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfetto per Lian Li O11 Air
reviews.reviewText: Ricevuto in tempi brevissimi come sempre su questa piattaforma.Installato in pochissimo su un case Lian-Li O11 Air, supporta pienamente la 4090.Tutto si incastra perfettamente e l'effetto finale è fantastico.Lascia abbastanza spazio sotto per installare dischi M.2 con dissipatore anche ingombrante e i cavi di connessione che spesso sono posti nella parte inferiore della scheda madre.La struttura è solida.

reviews.reviewTitle: Gran calidad del soporte perfecto para rtx 40, pero una extensión mediocre...
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Es un soporte de calidad, puede soportar mi RTX 4080 gaming x trio sin problema alguno, le quedó a la perfeccion a mi corsair 5000D, las instrucciones son claras y es fácil de armar, no hay errores de funcionamiento, pero ¿Por qué 4 estrellas?-1 ya que la calidad de construcción de la extensión es mediocre, se rompió el sujetador para la tarjeta y para el costo no se me hace algo válido, por suerte no arruina el funcionamiento y no tuve necesidad de devolverlo.Algo que nadie en general te dice al momento de comprar un soporte vertical sea la marca que sea es que vas a tener que deformar tu gabinete de los slots para que el cable de video entre, no le doy menos estrellas ya que no es algo que sea culpa del producto, pero solo ojo a eso.Fuera de eso la verdad me gustó, justo como esperaba que se viera mi pc.
Lo recomiendo, me desanime un poco por unas reseñas del producto pero aún asi lo compre, no me arrepiento se ve muy bien.
